content: *perfect for a first crochet shawl edith is made with a classic granny stitch pattern and gradient striping for a modern twist using a large hook for a lacy and airy texture top-down construction and repetitive stitches makes an easy yet satisfying project with fast results when blocked at a 90-degree angle from tip to tip the granny stitch opens into a lovely drapey triangular shawl perfect for cool nights in spring and summer * **skill level ** beginner slip_stitch single_crochet double_crochet **yarn ** 2 skiens of wooley warbler fluff 38% baby alpaca 25% merino 37% pima cotton 437 yards 100g **hook size ** j / 6 0mm **gauge ** approx 4 clusters by 7 row 10cm x 10cm 4 gauge is not crucial **construction ** crocheted flat **size ** approx 34 86cm deep by 55 141cm for long edge
